description.b: ASSET uses a workspace to contain your data. Data in this workspace is stored in Project folders. So you need to create a folder. This is also a convenient time to integrate some sample data and check that you have a valid XML editor

item.title: Open the navigator
item.description: The Navigator window is your view of your data files. It should be visible at the top-left of ASSET. If it isn't open it via Window/Show View/Navigator, or by using 'Click to perform' below.

item.title: Check you have a project
item.description: When first opened, workspaces are typically empty. You create a project that contains either your data files, or a number of links to existing data. So, have a look in your Navigator and see if there are any folders (projects) listed there.

item.title: Create a 'General' project
item.description: If your navigator is empty, then yes, you need to create a project. Right-click in the Navigator view, and select 'Project...' from the 'New' sub-menu. The New Project wizard will open. From the 'General' folder, select Project, and then press 'Next'. Now just enter a name for your project (this could be your name or the name of the current simulation exercise). Lastly press the 'Finish' button, and you will see the new project in your workspace. Or use the 'Click to run' link below to quickly open the New project window.

item.title: Include link to sample data
item.description: Right-click on your current project in the Navigator view, then select 'Folder' from the 'New' sub-menu. The New Folder wizard will open. Instead of creating a fresh child folder to store our data, we're going to link to an existing folder. So, whilst still in the New Folder Wizard, click the 'Advanced' button to display the Advanced options. Next, click on the 'Link to folder in the file system', and navigate to the 'sample_data' folder that's contained within your ASSET installation folder, then clicking on "Finish" to, erm, Finish. The 'Click to perform' button below will open the folder dialog for you - though you'll have to specify the parent project for the folder.

item.title: Check you have an XML editor

description.b: ASSET uses data files that adhere to the XML data standard. XML is easily read and manipulated by computers, but can be a little verbose and fiddly when edited by humans. That's why we use an XML Editor that hides some of the fiddly details

subitem.label: The Oxygen xml editor is a mature application that's available both in standalone form and as an Eclipse plugin (Eclipse is the 'framework' that ASSET is built on top of). We're distributing the Oxygen xml editor with ASSET but since it's a commercial application there are unfortunately licensing issues to resolve - specifically, it requires you to enter license details before you can run it.

Verify that Oxygen is installed by right-clicking on an xml file in your navigator. In the Open-With drop-down of the popup menu you should see Oxygen XML Editor. If it's there, you're fine. If it isn't, then you should see your ASSET maintainer to get Oxygen installed. Of course, if you're an XML wizard you may choose to run through the tutorial in plain text mode - but I don't think you're reached level 3 geek-dom yet.
